page.title: 02THE VILLAGE OF LEE MOOR.
page.content: Before the discovery of china clay in the area,there were very few buildings,just several farms.In the 1830's china clay started to be taken from just below the surface and people started to move to the area for work. Since then the village has grown, providing a community for workers to live in.There was a school until several years ago but now few children live in the village.There are two churches,one Methodist and the other Anglican.There is a small post office and a shop which is open in the mornings.The village is surrounded by china clay workings.Several of the waste tips have been grassed which helps to cut down the dust.The village has various sporting facilities and a village hall where various clubs meet.Over half of the population is retired.
